com.facebook.widget

Class FacebookDialog.Builder<CONCRETE extends FacebookDialog.Builder<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.widget.FacebookDialog.Builder<CONCRETE>
  • Type Parameters:
    CONCRETE - The concrete base class of the builder.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FacebookDialog.MessageDialogBuilder, FacebookDialog.OpenGraphActionDialogBuilder, FacebookDialog.OpenGraphMessageDialogBuilder, FacebookDialog.PhotoMessageDialogBuilder, FacebookDialog.PhotoShareDialogBuilder, FacebookDialog.ShareDialogBuilder
    Enclosing class:
    FacebookDialog

    public abstract static class FacebookDialog.Builder<CONCRETE extends FacebookDialog.Builder<?>>
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a base class for various FacebookDialog builders. This is public primarily to allow its use elsewhere in the Android SDK; developers are discouraged from constructing their own FacebookDialog builders as the internal API may change.

    • Method Detail

      • setRequestCode

        public CONCRETE setRequestCode(int requestCode)
        Sets the request code that will be passed to handleActivityResult when this activity completes; the default is NativeProtocol.DIALOG_REQUEST_CODE.
        Parameters:
        requestCode - the request code
        Returns:
        this instance of the builder

      • setApplicationName

        public CONCRETE setApplicationName(java.lang.String applicationName)
        Sets the name of the application to be displayed in the dialog. If provided, this optimizes the user experience as a preview of a shared item, etc., can be displayed sooner.
        Parameters:
        applicationName - the name of the Facebook application
        Returns:
        this instance of the builder

      • setFragment

        public CONCRETE setFragment(android.support.v4.app.Fragment fragment)
        Sets the fragment that should launch the dialog. This allows the dialog to be launched from a Fragment, and will allow the fragment to receive the onActivityResult call rather than the Activity.
        Parameters:
        fragment - the fragment that contains this control

      • build

        public FacebookDialog build()
        Constructs a FacebookDialog with an Intent that is correctly populated to present the dialog within the Facebook application.
        Returns:
        a FacebookDialog instance

      • getWebFallbackUrlInternal

        protected java.lang.String getWebFallbackUrlInternal()
        This is public primarily to allow its use elsewhere in the Android SDK; developers are discouraged from consuming this method as the internal API may change.

      • canPresent

        public boolean canPresent()
        Determines whether the native dialog can be presented (i.e., whether the required version of the Facebook application is installed on the device, and whether the installed version supports all of the parameters specified for the dialog).
        Returns:
        true if the dialog can be presented; false if not
